output: Katy, you don’t know?
She eloped and registered their marriage with Xiaohong.
Xiao Hong
Indeed.
You are unaware of this matter.

Regarding last time, they weren't having a birthday, and you brought something, and I didn't bring Katy. Then the two of you got to know each other, got to know them, and had a meal together alone—I don’t really know how you ended up together.
Indeed.

I don’t know about this matter, nor do I recall Katy sending me a photo on that day. Upon seeing it, I initially thought it was a counterfeit – a marriage certificate. I genuinely believed it was a forgery at first. But upon closer inspection, it turned out to be a real marriage certificate; they had genuinely registered their marriage. It seems they had taken a liking to each other.
Bringing people like you is quite a good arrangement, and KT also took a liking to the two of them. They chatted and got along well, and the chemistry was right.
Really, if you're going to bother, don't look at that kind of thing. I'm telling you, their facial features are genuinely well-proportioned; examine them closely.
It’s not quite a perfect match, but it’s still quite suitable. Let’s just wish them well.
I haven't contacted you, Kitty, for quite some time. How has he been lately?
They registered their marriage.
Impossible! How could this be? How could they be ten years apart? How could they possibly be together?
Oh, that day.
They resumed their conversation on that topic.
How utterly unbelievable—who is pursuing whom?
The age difference is due to circumstances within his family.
Oh dear, true love isn't really about age.
What, then, is their compatibility? Their personalities are also incompatible, aren't they?
Alas, Buddhas, Buddhas.
I'm hesitant to mention them individually; let’s make separate arrangements now.
You don’t know, do you?
Silently depart.
Regarding those who quietly married at the time, whether we were unaware, or whether I was secretly aware, now that they have separated, am I quietly aware, or did I hear it from others?

I have no idea. Perhaps at that moment, KT found the conditions quite appealing, but after spending some time together, they realized they weren't a match, their personalities didn't click. It should be...
I do not know either.

It's not primarily about what, then? It was that time, right? You didn't say you felt the two of them were unsuitable? I also thought they were quite a good match. Now, as you predicted, you said they were unsuitable.
I believe you arranged it, not that I arranged it.
I thought you were playing matchmaker. I really thought it was you. But they knew each other already; they were together at the time.
Ah, I see. Then, let's not eat with them. Let's schedule something separately. I’ll check and ask about the situation.
Let us speak of it no further.
Hey, look, how about we get KD and his wife together and all go out to eat these couple of days?
It's not that you and he don't have a good relationship. Give me a call, and I’ll arrange it for tomorrow without any expense.
What is the matter?
What is disconnected?
It hasn’t been that long since you got married, has it?
It’s not that your marriage is about to end so quickly—what’s the reason?
If our eyes don't meet, why would we get married then? At that time?
There must be a reason for this, surely.
You see, at that time, I felt that the age difference between them would certainly prevent a successful outcome. I truly didn’t expect that they’ve only been married for just over a month.
I was wrong to marry him; our ages are incompatible, with a difference of over a decade. We were divorced just a little over a month after the marriage.
Knowing back then that you and she had a good relationship, wouldn't I ask you about everything?
Let’s not schedule individual meetings; let's meet together instead.
It wasn't me, Xiaohong. I told you to choose a location closer to the subway, didn’t I? This place is three kilometers from the subway – that's inconvenient for my commute.
It’s not you, it’s the rising sun. Look at the size of other people’s windows. Look at this window, it's just so small. I’ll just put in an eye to watch the rising sun.

It's not, this isn't a rigid requirement, is it? What I want is a decent place. The walls are crumbling, everything is a mess, and there's even mildew. Can’t you look for some other apartments for me?
You are speaking inappropriately. I paid you to help me, so you should help me.

I'm certain this money can secure a decent place; please find me something suitable. There are so many options nearby, why this specific complex? Do you have limited capabilities, just searching for this kind of property?
Isn't it that the smell of formaldehyde is so strong? I can’t even enter without getting sick. Who will be responsible if I do?
Let's sign a contract: if I fall ill, you'll arrange for my treatment and cover the expenses.
Alright, alright. I see your capabilities are just like this. Forget it. Truly.
You see this room; this is a room that just became available on this side.

It's not so much about him, but rather the housing market is particularly tight now. And this room is also quite good. Look at the environment, it's very pleasant. The windows face south, does this meet your requirements?
A window is all you need. You're living alone anyway, it's not like—
And you see, the bathroom has this room, it has everything it should—a washing machine, a refrigerator. Look, this refrigerator.
It’s not that I’m telling you this lightly, but if I had to handle these few clients of yours every month, I’d be annoyed myself, you know.
You said there were good deals, so I looked for some for you. You said they were hard to come by, and now you say this isn't good enough, that isn't good enough? You're just finding fault.
If you’re truly capable, having this house is already quite remarkable; being able to live in it would be a considerable achievement.

But look, I've found a place near the subway. I’m looking for something near the subway. But the fees are high, and it doesn't suit you. Let me find something a bit further out, okay? You also complain about the steel-framed houses. How about something white, completely white?

Don't tell me this—it's just that when I scraped the big white one, it wasn't fragrant. You’re setting your expectations too high. You say you’re really like this—I have clients like you one month. Forget it, I'm not renting it anymore, I’m not renting it anymore.
Xiao Gang came over to take a look and see how things were.
Isn't that possible?
Very good. The Chaoyang district.
It wasn't as if we weren't having a perfectly good conversation online just now, and you said to come over to rent. Now you're starting to find fault. What is this?
Seaweed.
You should find someone to clean it for you beforehand. First, see if this floor plan suits you. You talk so much, really…
It’s not me, the person in charge, who designed the room like that. If it doesn’t suit you, I’ll repaint it white. If you want it black, I’ll repaint it black. I'm not saying...
How wonderful! Ten years without a visit—look at this sign.
Xiao Gang, I've noticed you always meddle. We're all chatting online, and I realize this isn't my concern, is it?
Quite good.
These are all antiques from my family. You're dismissing them as old relics? You absolutely cannot replace them. You already agreed to use these items when you came and go.
The faucet is gushing water; you should try your own faucet.

Let me put it this way: this entire building now belongs to me. Look at this key I have. I possess this entire key, but only this one unit is suitable for the price you’re offering. Rent it if you want, don’t rent it if you don't—never mind.
Grandmother, Grandmother, please go quickly. Who is speaking? Who is this saying?
It's not just this house, you see.
I say, landlord sister, you see, you see this window.
The morning sun is too weak. As a man, I have certain preferences, and the ventilation isn’t good either.
Very well, you continue. Look at the ground.
And this, you see this? Would anyone live here? The room… a single breath, a single roll… it's impossible to describe that kind of smell.

It’s not that I’m speaking, but my initial feeling is that it’s not good. Go take a look - on this side it’s white, on that side it’s black. You see, when you scrape it white, you know the scraped clouds will be a bit…
I'm not saying, sister, but your refrigerator is already ten years old, isn't it?
That is a well-known brand, isn't it? Look, the scent inside—no matter what you add, it won't work.
This isn’t about me causing trouble; look at the washing machine, see? Oh.
How can this be used when it's all rusted?
Using your things, I say these are unusable. I've observed these items are unusable. Can one bathe here? Is bathing possible in this place?
You've washed it to the point where I can't wash it anymore; leave it as it is. Look, the head is gone, and the bath roller is here, but the head is missing.

Oh dear, to be honest, truly, madam, could you find me a place where the expenses are roughly manageable by myself, and the environment is at least agreeable—with good air quality and a pleasant environment?
Okay, okay, I won’t rent it. I won’t rent it.
What’s wrong with being thirty? Isn’t it normal to have a relationship at thirty? Aren’t you, Dad, thinking I’m too old? What’s wrong with being thirty and single? Isn’t that fine?
No, no, no, Dad. You raised me because you chose to. If you have the ability, don't raise me then. I'm growing up.

Your age is not my concern. You raised me, wasn’t it because you wanted to? I am thirty and I’m doing just fine on my own. You say I should find someone who loves me, but what if I find a partner who doesn’t? Will you take responsibility? Will you find someone for me?
I enjoy those who like me, but I don’t enjoy those who don't. I'm not saying I've never liked others; people haven't returned my affections. Don’t give me that.
I simply don't want to be in a romantic relationship; so what if I deal in cotton? Dealing in cotton can also earn money.
Are you alright? My current salary is sufficient to support you. Since we're both women, it would be wonderful to be together, wouldn't it? No problem at all.

You just say you feel it's difficult for us to live together if I truly find a partner—that we won't be able to live together, and how would you support me in old age? Isn't this quite good? We are both single now, and that’s wonderful, isn't it?
I didn’t provoke you. It's you who seems upset with me. When did I ever make you angry? This is truly tiresome.
You say you’re in your early thirties, and I just want to ask you when you’ll be able to start dating.
It's been just me all these years. After your mother passed, it was just me who provided for you—food, drink, hygiene, everything. I raised you single-handedly.
I only hope, my daughter, I only hope you can find a man you love and who loves you. Dad begs you, please find a partner.
I am getting older.
Wouldn't you find one you like?
Don't tell me those useless things. If you simply don't want to date, then don't. Why would you talk about cotton?
In your early thirties, daughter, if you don’t start dating, do you expect your father to support you for the rest of your life?
I truly tell you, having a daughter like you can genuinely infuriate me.
Alright, I’ll give you a final deadline: this year, you must bring a son-in-law home to me.
Dad, you were snooping on my phone.
I don’t care about this father. My phone, I said before, you shouldn’t look at it anymore. I’m practically an adult now, I’m soon to be eighteen. You shouldn't be doing that.

I haven’t focused on my studies, have I? I'm currently in the top ten of the entire grade; I haven't let you down, have I? What exactly am I doing now? I don’t need you to inquire about it; it’s pointless. All I care about now is that you study diligently.

What I do, I feel you have no right to interfere with. I am quite grown now. If you insist on this, I have nothing further to say. Next time, don't look at my phone either; I will not allow you to discover any of my conversations within it.
I'm not afraid of your father, and you are not currently…
I'm not upset with you; you're the one who wants to feel this way. I’ve told you.
On what grounds is confiscation permissible?

It wasn't you who told me when you bought this phone that I would manage it myself and use it. Now you want to take it away. How will I contact anyone when I'm at school? How will I reach you when I get home? You've lost it; you're going now.
When did I ever start a relationship with you? At what point did you think I was having an early relationship? Just seeing those two characters is enough for you to believe I was?
What’s wrong with being 16? I’m quite grown now.
I said I was in a relationship, didn’t I? I didn't say I was. Is it you who think I’m in a relationship?
It is not that we, the young people of today, speak this way. If you are not accustomed to it, you need not adapt; we will continue to speak as we do.
What do you mean? Go ahead, hit me then, Dad.
Please explain to me who this boy is that I've been chatting with on my phone.
Am I your father and not permitted to see these things? I'm asking you, are you dating?
How old are you? Eighteen. An adult. Let me tell you, in our rural area, if you’re a boy, your parents can still manage if you start dating.
Don't forget you're a girl, you know? You're a girl. How could you fall in love in high school so early? My dear, you're in high school now. Shouldn't you focus your attention on your studies?
You really mean it, don't you?
Are you simply trying to anger me directly?
You need to feel that way yourself, and I’m telling you that starting this year, this phone will be confiscated.
On what grounds do you claim, based on a mere gesture, that I am your father?
It is early romance, understand? It is early romance; your thoughts are not focused on your studies.
Your sixteen-year-old daughter, you are only sixteen this year.
To start a romantic relationship right now?
The chat logs you’re referencing are so meager. Where are you all? Are you elementary school students? Where did you learn this behavior at such a young age?
If you say that again, I will slap you.
I have nothing more to say to you. Let's talk when your mother returns.
What do you mean by “爸”? Please explain. I understand everything else.
Auntie Xiaohong, I call her Auntie, just like I do with you. So, you want me to call her Auntie, one zodiac sign.
Alright, you don't need to call her "Auntie Xiaohongya" anymore, just call her Xiaohong. Thank you, Dad. I really can't stand it.
When will you say it's time to get married, Dad? If you said "dating," I'd just turn a blind eye and let it go. But now you’re telling me "marriage"? What do you mean?
That was me and Wang Yue.
I haven't received a call from Xiaohong either; we haven't been in contact. Why don't you summon Xiaohong then?
Stop it. She married him. Aunt Xiaohong became my mother. Can I call her Mom?
Do you think this is acceptable? Can you bear it yourself? I'm the same age as Xiaohong, and then I call her "mother." Doesn't that make you uncomfortable?

What happened to Xiaohong? Don't let me call Mom. Please, don't let me call Mom. It's like that, right? You're dating her, I won’t say anything. But if you want to marry her, I’m telling you, absolutely not.
Do you know why there’s no way out? He wants to marry you, but she wants to divide the assets.
I am an only child, and you need to add his name to the household registration. I'm telling you, I am cutting off our father-daughter relationship. I'm telling you.
If he makes you enter my house, I will absolutely cut off all ties with you. I’m not lying.

Just don't let that Little Hong, Little Hong's mother, or Auntie Hong—don’t let any of them cause trouble. I’m telling you, just have her leave. In any case, just don’t let me see her, don't let me discover her.
It's not Haha Ba, this time I’m giving you Aunt Xiaohong—over a year of life now.
You know, the relationship between me and your Aunt Xiaohong and I.
You are disagreeing with this marriage arrangement between us, aren't you?
I’ve raised you, my daughter, for nothing, Dad. Hancin, you’ve caused me so much bitterness. After you left with your mother all these years ago, has she ever called you?
Have I ever cared for you? Have I ever bought you anything? It was all from your father.

I and Xiaohong are about to get married immediately.
This time, I want to discuss this with you.
As long as you agree, Xiaohong will be your stepmother.
I will cherish you, and Xiaohong will certainly cherish you as well.
You suggest severing ties with women.
It infuriates me.
What is it?
I believe I am beginning to understand what has happened.
Just say it directly, don't call me like this.
Auntie Lanlan, Lanlan used to be my best friend. Is it because you two are getting married that I have to call her Mom now? What are you implying, Dad? Do I still have you as my father?
It's not that blue thing—did it brainwash you, or what? You came to our house, and you just took a liking to him.
I told you why he insisted on coming to my house that day—it's because he’ll never be satisfied unless you earn some money; he'll just keep demanding more.

I've finally seen through him, Dad. You don't need to say anything more. This Lanlan is not to be trusted now. Please ask her to leave immediately. I'm telling you, if she ever truly enters our home, I won't claim a single penny of the estate.
You, alone, you, alone—you seek others. Why do you seek Lanlan? I don’t understand. Lanlan, how could she give it to you?
It's been over a year, I think.

It's not my father—I only started calling him that six months ago. 
So you two were already together before?
I don’t know if I'm up to it.
If your father were to enter our home for even a single day, I would sever all ties with you as your daughter.
You handle it as you see fit. Things are like this now – if he's here, I'm not; if I'm here, he's not. You decide.
Darling, I want to discuss something with you.
Isn’t it possible for you to bring a smile to Dad’s face?
Just say it directly.
I intend to have Auntie speak with you about this, to obtain your consent for the two of us.
It's not that I'm asking if you are my father.
No, not at all. Let me tell you about my daughter. You know this too—after your mother and I separated, your father has been alone ever since.
I went to see Grandma. I went to see Grandma. Now, we've been developing a relationship for over a year. What's wrong?
Then I’ll give you Auntie Lanlanlanlan. You'll call her Auntie from now on, won’t you?
Now you know, don't you?
What is this, a father-daughter relationship?
Learning.
What am I doing now, Master?
It's not you, Master, so how could you see that I haven't studied diligently? I'm just holding on—you even praised me before, didn't you?
You say this carving of mine is good, I’ll tell you.
No, no, no, no, no. Master, look, I already feel like you're almost as old as my father. You're even more forceful than my father, you know?

I’ve been learning this craft with my hands all along. Haven't you noticed we can't sell anything? If we can't sell anything, what does that mean? It means we won't make any money. If we won’t make any money, what am I carving? I’m now starting to carve some innovative pieces. And you’re saying I’m wrong again.
However, customers find this innovative product quite good.
I am teaching you.
But sales are good, aren't they? You're making money, right? You can't even afford the rent. Why shouldn't I complain?

It's not the master, it's not you. I ask you, with this old way of thinking, how many carvings of yours can you sell now? Tell me, did you sell even one a month? Did those carvings you made actually sell? Master, this month I carved ten and sold nine.

Are you still clinging to these outdated ideas and not being flexible? The fact that I can sell these items proves that our innovation is useful. My carvings are meaningful, they have significance. They want to buy, they want to buy—if so, our store can expand a bit.
They truly want to look at my face before they buy your carvings. Why buy mine? Because they can use this one as a gift; yours, they cannot give away.
Not the master.
I do not.
No master.
I apologize, Master.
You say you use a broken phone every day to arrange things—what exactly? And have you studied this carving technique?
Did you learn?
You, at such a young age, spend all day on your phone, and expect me to teach you a craft? Have you even put any effort into learning? Have you?
I praise you; that is me praising you.
Let me tell you, you’re so young, everything I’ve given you are things I experienced when I was young. When I was young, many people sought me out to seek guidance.
You are acting as if you are sitting here like my superior.
Are you here to learn a trade, or are you here to act the big shot?
What exactly are you consuming?

Is this how I taught you?
Was this how I taught you?
Let me tell you, I’m watching because your father and I are good friends. I’m teaching you this: if you continue like this, go home and act like a young master.
I will not accept you as my apprentice if you seek to be my little girl.
Those you've sold—they're all your classmates and friends, doing it out of face for you, you know? Just take a look at what you’re actually peddling.
Do you feel you are now full and complacent?
To dare call me, your teacher, out loud? You’ve just learned to walk, and now you want to fly.
Do you want to fly?
Alright, tomorrow I'll return home and be your young master. I will no longer accept you as my apprentice.
Just now, did you see that glass walkway? Let’s go that way.

This is truly irresistible, isn't it? I hired you to be here, Gang brother. Last time you helped me so much, I said I’d treat you to something really fun and exciting. Didn’t you agree? Look how good this is. Go ahead, try the next one.
It's not that you look down, you relax, looking down is so exciting. Look, look, the little animals are greeting you. Look, tilt your head down a little.

You being just a bit slower is truly alright, it's really alright. 
But it's frightening to watch.
Come, let me pull you. Come, let me pull you.
Come.
Just take a step forward. Don't look down. Otherwise, look at me, focus your gaze on me. Yes, take a step forward, one, two steps.
Are you alright? Did one of your feet come up? Bring your other foot forward, come on. Take two steps forward. Don’t look down. Why are you crying? Don’t fuss. Get up, get up, get up.

It's alright, look at me, let's walk across. We can't turn back, do you understand? Gang brother, we absolutely can’t go back now. Once you're on this trestle, we won’t be able to return. We can only proceed after passing this point, so don't be afraid.
If you're alright, run with me; follow me, one, two, look ahead, run well.
This, this, this, this.
Let’s return the tickets, right? I absolutely cannot do that.
Do not move me.
I can’t; my legs are weak.
Don't, don't, don't move me.
You seem to have shoved your rear end forward. I'm not playing anymore.
Isn't this taking my life? I can't move my legs anymore. I...
Just what does this mean?
Older brother, you're not joking, are you? Don’t tie me up, don’t tie me up. I haven’t agreed yet, I haven’t agreed yet.

Not me, no money, so painful, I have no money, so painful.
No, no, no.
Oh dear!
Could you...?
Just now I was really scared, I was truly scared, I was scared. Please don't continue.
Where shall we look ahead?
Please do not push me, push you. Let it go. Please do not push. I beg you, do not push.

Just a moment.
Just a moment.
Just a moment.
Not.
Wait, I’m not ready yet.
You are killing me, you're all here.
However
No, no, no, just listen to me now.
I know, I know, I know. Let me catch my breath. Let me catch my breath.
